p: Small clinical experiences have been published with the use of donor pool intravenous immunoglobulin (IVIG) [ 7, 177]. Their role is unclear, nevertheless IVIG may have both a partial inhibitory viral effect due to nonspecific cross-reaction, and a well-known immunomodulatory effect in several inflammatory conditions, including macrophage activation syndrome [ 178]. IVIG use may be most relevant in patients with specific organ involvement such as myocarditis and Guillan-Barr√© syndrome, which have also been reported in association with SARS CoV-2 infection [ 179].
